title: 108_hr2472
content: The Act titled "District of Columbia Budget Autonomy Act of 2003" amends Section 446 of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act regarding the enactment of the local budget. The Council must adopt the annual budget for the District of Columbia government within 50 days of receiving the proposal from the Mayor. Any supplements must also be adopted after a public hearing. In control years, the budget adopted must be submitted by the Mayor to the President for transmission to Congress. During control years, the Mayor must submit the adopted budget to the President for transmission to Congress, following the completion of budget procedures outlined in the Act. The Mayor must submit the adopted budget to the President for transmission to Congress after completing budget procedures outlined in the Act. No unauthorized obligations or expenditures by District of Columbia government officers or employees are allowed unless approved by the Council through an Act. No amount can be spent by any District of Columbia government officer or employee without approval by the Council through an Act, or by Congress during a control year. After the adoption of the annual budget, reprogramming of amounts in the budget requires approval by the Mayor and Council. After the annual budget is adopted, reprogramming of budget amounts must be approved by the Mayor and Council, with any additional expenditures offset by reductions in other activities. The term 'control year' is defined as per the District of Columbia Financial Responsibility and Management Assistance Act of 1995. Section 602(c) of the Act is amended to include a new paragraph regarding the length of the Congressional review period for budget acts. The Congressional review period for budget acts is amended to take effect after a 30-calendar-day period from transmission, or as specified in the Act, if the fiscal year is not a control year. Amendments are made to various sections of the District of Columbia Financial Responsibility and Management Assistance Act of 1995, including changes to sections 202(c)(2) and 202(d)(3)(A) related to section 446. Amendments to the District of Columbia Home Rule Act involve changes to section 404(f), including the removal of specific language and the addition of new wording. Amendments to section 404(f) of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act include renumbering subsections, removing defined terms, and adding a new definition for "control year." SEC. 4 of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act is amended to allow employees to be hired if the position is authorized by the Council. SEC. 5 includes other amendments related to changes in the federal role in the budget process. The definition of 'control year' in the Act is clarified. SEC. 6. CONTINUATION OF GENERAL PROVISIONS IN APPROPRIATIONS ACTS. Any general provision in a general appropriation bill regarding Federal payments to the District of Columbia will remain in effect until the enactment of a new bill for the following fiscal year. SEC. 7. EFFECTIVE DATE. The amendments made by this Act will apply to the District of Columbia budgets for fiscal years starting on or after October 1, 2004.
